abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo says state will pay billions of dollars toward gap in Metropolitan Transportation Authority's $32 billion capital plan; also asserts that New York City should sharply increase its contribution, to as much as $3 billion.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said the state would pay billions toward the gap in the Metropolitan Transportation Authority’s plan, and he urged the city to increase its contribution, to as much as $3 billion.

headline.main: Cuomo Says New York City Should Contribute More to M.T.A. Capital Plan
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Says State Will Help Close M.T.A. Gap and City Should Pay More, Too

snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said the state would pay billions toward the gap in the Metropolitan Transportation Authority’s plan, and he urged the city to increase its contribution, to as much as $3 billion.
